The status quo is not working for our trade/economy. Trade deficit doesn't make us stronger. Manufacturing is regulated to such levels to push them out of the country and leave. Those that are still here import H-1b visa'd workers from 3rd world countries. We are getting screwed on both sides of it.

At any moment that kid could have changed his mind, shot her, left her office, shot anyone else... As a school counselor and mental health professional, regardless of whether or not they ask for help, a situation with a student/client can turn bad without warning. What she did was remarkable and brave. There is no minimizing the danger everyone was in because he was asking for help. Sometimes I find myself uncomfortable because a kid is holding a sharp pencil and in a bad way. I can't even imagine.

We have an epidemic of unjustified police shootings and killings in this country. A level unacceptable to any other modern Western country. It's mainly due to police being taught an us vs them mentality, in contrast to policing in other countries where they are servants and protectors of society.

Assad's US-backed Lebanese allies show the same 'humanity' to refugees fleeing genocide as the West, making already dispossessed and persecuted people homeless once again... 'Lebanese army forcibly evacuates Syrian refugee camps' #Lebanon 09-08-2016: 'Syrian refugees in al-Manya camp in northern Lebanese city of Tripoli said army personnel warned managers of 17 camps to evacuate within 48 hours starting from Monday. Refugee Abu Hasan al-Idlibi told Zaman al-Wasl the Lebanese army will bulldoze every camp which does not evacuate. Idlibi who resides in Naser al-Zareqa camp confirmed that Lebanese army personnel arrested 20 refugee young men by raiding the camp under pretext of refugees owning motorcycles. He mentioned the Lebanese officer warned orally during the raid the residents in the camps in the town to start deportation during two days without locating any alternative land to build their camps or where they can relocate to. A local source told Zaman al-Wasl the camps which started evacuating are Udai Hilal camp, Mohamed Abu Hasan camp, Nasal al-Qaydi camp, Mohamed Abbas camp, Hatem Dawlat al-Abed Satar camp, Abu Khaled al-Jamal camp, and al-Makhaseem camp. Residents from Khaled Alam al-Din camp, where families from Hama and Homs live in al-Manya town, said the Lebanese officer told them not to establish any camps in the area extended from Tripoli to the Syrian borders.'
